content.full_text: Fitz Henry Warren to Abraham Lincoln, 11 May 18491 I have the honor to inform you, that thePostmaster Generalhas appointedJohn HutchisonPostmaster atTwelve Milein the State ofIllinoisin place ofJ. R. Young— Resigned2
paragraphs: Fitz Henry Warren to Abraham Lincoln, 11 May 18491
I have the honor to inform you, that thePostmaster Generalhas appointedJohn HutchisonPostmaster atTwelve Milein the State ofIllinoisin place ofJ. R. Young— Resigned2
citations:
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, 145 rolls, Records of the Post Office Department,
                     RG 28, 1845-1855, 18:172, National Archives Building, Washington, DC;Register of all Officers and Agents, Civil, Military, and Naval, in the Service of
                        the United States, on   the Thirtieth September, 1849(Washington, DC: Gideon, 1849), 490*;Register of all Officers and Agents, Civil, Military, and Naval, in the Service of
                        the United States, on   the Thirtieth September, 1851(Washington, DC: Gideon, 1851), 541*.

footnotes.text: 1Fitz Henry Warren signed this form letter.

2John Hutchison served as postmaster from May 1849 to  March 1850.Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, 145 rolls, Records of the Post Office Department,
                     RG 28, 1845-1855, 18:172, National Archives Building, Washington, DC;Register of all Officers and Agents, Civil, Military, and Naval, in the Service of
                        the United States, on   the Thirtieth September, 1849(Washington, DC: Gideon, 1849), 490*;Register of all Officers and Agents, Civil, Military, and Naval, in the Service of
                        the United States, on   the Thirtieth September, 1851(Washington, DC: Gideon, 1851), 541*.
